title: Vaccine Information Statements (VIS)
description: CDC Vaccine Information Statements (VISs) explain to vaccine recipients both the benefits and risks of a vaccine. Federal law requires that VISs be handed out before vaccinations are given.
cleaned_text: Vaccine Information Statements (VIS) The Fact Sheet provides similar content to vaccine information statements (VISs) for licensed vaccines but differs in that the EUA Fact Sheet is specific to each authorized COVID-19 vaccine, is developed by the manufacturer of the vaccine, and is authorized by the FDA. [Instructions for Using VISs](/vaccines/hcp/vis/about/required-use-instructions.html) Read and print an information sheet about the use of VISs, including recordkeeping requirements. [Facts About VISs](/vaccines/hcp/vis/about/facts-vis.html) Find information about provider responsibilities, types of VISs, legal requirements for using VISs. [VIS Frequently Asked Questions](/vaccines/hcp/vis/about/vis-faqs.html) Find answers to commonly asked questions. [Translations](http://www.immunize.org/vis/) Find VISs translated into other languages. Vaccine Information Statements (VISs) are information sheets produced by the CDC that explain both the benefits and risks of a vaccine to vaccine recipients. [Federal law](/vaccines/hcp/vis/about/facts-vis.html#law) requires that healthcare staff [provide](/vaccines/hcp/vis/about/facts-vis.html#give) a VIS to a patient, parent, or legal representative before each dose of certain vaccines.
